howItWorks.title: How it works
howItWorks.subtitle: ODAN connects people who need tech help with verified volunteers, with transparency and safety.

sections.title: Open a ticket
body: Describe your problem with as much context as possible.
You can add images and details to help volunteers understand faster.

sections.title: Get matched with a volunteer
body: A volunteer can accept your ticket and guide you step by step.
You can follow progress and communicate during the process.

sections.title: Receive a response
body: Volunteers can respond with rich text, time tracking, sources, and optional images.
Our goal is a safe, human and auditable support experience.

volunteers.title: For volunteers
volunteers.subtitle: Help people around the world with real impact and transparent records.

sections.title: Accept tickets
body: Pick tickets that match your knowledge and availability.
Work with a clear history and structured updates.

sections.title: Use the tools
body: Write responses with rich formatting and tracked time.
Use the whiteboard when visuals help explain the solution.

sections.title: Get certified
body: Generate verifiable certificates based on your contribution.
Certificates can be validated publicly and support transparency.

about.title: About
about.subtitle: ODAN (Open Digital Assistance Network) is a community project focused on free, human and safe tech support.

sections.title: Our mission
body: Make quality tech help accessible to anyone.
Promote a safe environment with transparent processes.

sections.title: Transparency
body: We value traceable activity and verifiable certification.
This helps build trust for users and volunteers.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.subtitle: Quick answers to the most common questions.

sections.title: Is ODAN free?
body: Yes. ODAN is a community project focused on free tech help.
We do not charge requesters or volunteers.

sections.title: How are volunteers verified?
body: Volunteers build reputation through completed tickets and transparent history.
Moderation and reports help keep the experience safe.

sections.title: What should I include in a ticket?
body: Describe the problem, the device, and steps already tried.
Add screenshots or photos when possible.

safety.title: Safety & Trust
safety.subtitle: Guidelines to keep everyone safe while getting help.

sections.title: Protect your data
body: Never share passwords, 2FA codes, or sensitive personal data.
Redact confidential information before sending screenshots.

sections.title: Transparent help
body: Keep conversations inside the platform whenever possible.
Use the report feature if something feels suspicious.

sections.title: Respect and inclusion
body: Treat everyone with respect and patience.
Abusive behavior is not tolerated.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.subtitle: These terms describe how ODAN should be used.

sections.title: Use of the platform
body: Use ODAN responsibly and respectfully.
Do not submit illegal content or attempt to abuse the system.

sections.title: No guarantee
body: ODAN is provided as-is. Volunteers do their best, but outcomes may vary.
You remain responsible for actions taken on your devices.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: This policy explains how we handle data.

sections.title: Data we process
body: We process data necessary to authenticate and operate tickets.
We aim to minimize data and keep it protected.

sections.title: Security
body: We use reasonable measures to protect information.
Avoid sharing sensitive credentials or secrets in tickets.

contact.title: Contact
contact.subtitle: Need help or want to talk to the team?

sections.title: Support
body: If you need technical help, open a ticket in the Tickets area.
Provide details and screenshots whenever possible.

sections.title: Other topics
body: For non-technical topics, use the channels linked in the project repository.
We welcome feedback and contributions.
